New Records: The White Sox achieved their first comeback win of the season, breaking their 0-94 record when trailing after seven innings.
Key Match Events: Jonathan Cannon struck out seven in six scoreless innings.
Jack López hit his first career home run.
Zach DeLoach and Bryan Ramos hit back-to-back doubles in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Luis Robert Jr.'s towering fly ball was missed by Jack López, tying the game.
Andrew Benintendi hit a run-scoring single to give the White Sox the lead.
Justin Anderson locked down his first save of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: Jonathan Cannon expressed understanding of fans' frustration and appreciated their support during the game.
Andrew Benintendi acknowledged fans' desire to see history and was glad the team secured the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the start of 'Fan Appreciation Week' and was also 'Dog Day', allowing fans to bring their dogs to the stadium.
A full stadium-wide chant of 'Sell the team!' occurred in the fifth inning due to a mental error by White Sox players.
